poem:
For Pete  

In rooms where heavy atoms rest,  
your voice—clear, unyielding,  
a wind against waste,  
whispered truths—  
a guide to the wary,  
in labyrinths of decay.  

Silent sentry,  
you turned power,  
not to darkness,  
but to light—  
a lamp for the living.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Letter: Pete Wilkinson obituary In addition to all his other activities, Pete Wilkinson was a co-founder, with me, and several others, of Nuclear Waste Advisory Associates, an independent group of experts created to provide advice to communities considering hosting nuclear waste disposal. Pete was also a participant for many years in the energy department’s Nuclear Non-Governmental Organisation Forum, as well as chairing the Office for Nuclear Regulation’s NGO stakeholder forum, the first environmental activist to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
